metadata.titel_preek: A Baptism about Which They Never Told Us

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God breaks open the heavens to infuse Jesus and the Church with a 'free floating graceful energy' (Spirit) that empowers a new world of peace and healing.

tekstueel_bewijs: the heavens torn apart and the Spirit descending
God’s spirit came down into the world and settled upon the person of Jesus
God’s spirit is at work in the church, recruiting people

object.identificatie: A New World / New Life / Empowerment
tekstueel_bewijs: a quite new beginning of the life of the world
divine power is given through him that will make all things new
new world of peace and healing
The heavens—where God lives and from where God comes—break open
the church has been baptizing... in order to sign people on
the people at Ephesus were baptized again
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of the Spirit's invasion.

tekstueel_bewijs: a free floating graceful energy from God that changed everything
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who sends the Spirit as the Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that becomes an indwelling power.

tekstueel_bewijs: We are so settled, so bourgeois, so rational... so sure of ourselves
hate and war and greed and ambition are about to destroy us
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just personal sin but a systemic 'settledness' that resists the movement of God's new world.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church, having been empowered, performs acts of justice and reconciliation.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / The Baptized
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Acts of generosity, transformation, justice, and reconciliation
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (Spirit's invasion) provides the 'Pouvoir' (power) for the secondary program (Ethics).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God’s spirit came down into the world
God’s spirit is at work in the church, recruiting people
God’s own presence does come among us
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we 'do' babies when it is convenient
one had to be baptized in order to be a respectable citizen

voorbeelden: one had to be baptized in order to be a respectable citizen
Nobody ever told us about that
divine power is given through him

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the endowment of power (Pouvoir) rather than the imposition of duty (Devoir). Grace is defined as the gift of capacity.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Settledness) through ~S1 (John's Baptism of Repentance) to S1 (Jesus' Baptism of Spirit).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God 'tearing apart' the heavens—a divine intervention that bypasses human control.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; S2 is described as a 'dangerous time' of 'militarism' and 'greed'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is fundamentally theocentric. It explicitly moves beyond 'repentance' (human action) to 'empowerment' (divine action).

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Focus on human decision in John's baptism
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: requires a serious decision about living life in a new direction

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the initiator of the 'invasion'
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s own presence does come among us to invite us to new vulnerability

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is not an example to follow but the 'edge of a new world' and the 'initiator' of a history God is driving.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Jesus is the locus of divine authorization, not just a moral model.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of control; invitation to vulnerability.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is an act of God's 'invasion' rather than human 'attainment'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the baptism of Jesus to the baptism of the hearer is logically and actantially consistent.
spanning_punten: The tension between John's 'demanding' gospel and Jesus' 'graceful energy'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: taken up into the new reality where God’s life in the world was committed to them

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a 'settledness' and 'militarism' that 'destroys us all'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might still feel they must 'become' vulnerable (Subject) rather than being 'made' vulnerable (Receiver).
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that vulnerability is a fruit of the Spirit, not a prerequisite.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain POUVOIR but clarify the SAVOIR (the 'how' of the new deeds).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Provide more specific examples of 'new deeds' to ground the 'new imaginings'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful example of theocentric preaching that uses narrative structure to displace the human ego.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'As you may know' repetition, Greimasian analysis reveals the shift in Subject from John to the Spirit.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the meaning of 'dove'; Greimas focuses on the dove as a 'Helper' actant that transfers power.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'vulnerability' the preacher calls for is actually a modal state of 'Pouvoir' (the power to be weak) rather than a 'Devoir' (the duty to be humble).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'vulnerability' of a baby as a semiotic marker for the Receiver actant.
